Genetics is but a small part of disease.  A lot is environmental, and general randomness.  The problems with trying to predict are 1.  The tests aren't definitive, especially for young women, 2. Even if the tests come up positive it isn't clear that the disease will express itself and 3. The psychology of knowing a test is positive and living your life waiting for the desease to express itself (which it may never do) is a pretty hard way to live a life.I'm not sure your situation warrants testing due to the distance of your relatives who have CA to your daughters.2 cents.Louana
